channel.title: math.AT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: Mathematics -- Algebraic Topology (math.AT) updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive
channel.dc:subject: Mathematics -- Algebraic Topology

item.title: The pro-nilpotent Lawrence-Krammer-Bigelow representation. (arXiv:2211.01855v1 [math.GT])
item.description: We construct a 3-variable enrichment of the Lawrence-Krammer-Bigelow (LKB) representation of the braid groups, which is the limit of a pro-nilpotent tower of representations having the original LKB representation as its bottom layer. We also construct analogous pro-nilpotent towers of representations of surface braid groups and loop braid groups.
item.dc:creator: Martin Palmer, Arthur Soulié

item.title: The suspension of a 4-manifold and its applications. (arXiv:1909.11129v3 [math.AT] UPDATED)
item.description: Let $M$ be a smooth, orientable, closed, connected $4$-manifold and suppose that $H_1(M;\mathbb{Z})$ is finitely generated and has no $2$-torsion. We give a homotopy decomposition of the suspension of $M$ in terms of spheres, Moore spaces and $\Sigma\mathbb{C}P^{2}$. This is used to calculate any reduced generalized cohomology theory of $M$ as a group and to determine the homotopy types of certain current groups and gauge groups.
item.dc:creator: Tseleung So, Stephen Theriault

item.title: Constructing and calculating Adams operations on dualisable topological modular forms. (arXiv:2104.13407v2 [math.AT] UPDATED)
item.description: We construct Adams operations on the cohomology theory Tmf of topological modular forms; the first such stable operations on this cohomology theory. These Adams operations are then calculated on the Tmf-cohomology of spheres using a combination of descent spectral sequences, motivic homotopy theory, and Anderson duality. Applications of these operations are then given, including constructions of connective height 2 analogues of Adams summands and image of J spectra.
item.dc:creator: Jack Morgan Davies

item.title: Two remarks on spaces of maps between operads of little cubes. (arXiv:2211.00908v2 [math.AT] UPDATED)
item.description: We record two facts on spaces of derived maps between the operads $E_d$ of little $d$-cubes. Firstly, these mapping spaces are equivalent to the mapping spaces between the non-unitary versions of $E_d$. Secondly, all endomorphisms of $E_d$ are automorphisms. We also discuss variants for localisations of $E_d$ and for versions with tangential structures.
item.dc:creator: Geoffroy Horel, Manuel Krannich, Alexander Kupers
